The assembly name is defined here so it can be used to write log files

The Tingen web service, as well as its individual Modules, have various levels of functionality that
are determined by their Mode settings.
When a component is enabled, it will do work and (potentially) return a modified OptionObject.
When a component is disabled, it will not do work and will return an unmodified OptionObject.
Disabling the Tingen web service will disable all functionality, including all Module functionality.

The is the original data structure that is sent from
Avatar to Tingen, and contains all of the information Tingen needs to do its work.
It is important to note that the SentOptionObject is never modified by Tingen.

The is a string that tells Tingen what work needs to be done,
and how it should be done.
The Script Parameter will generally contain the following components:
Component Description
Module
The Tingen Module that will do the work (e.g.: "Admin")
Command
The requested command (e.g.: "Service")
Action
The requested action (e.g.: "Update")
Option
The (optional) option (e.g.: "All")
Some Script Parameters may not contain all of the above components, or may
contain additional components that aren't listed.
All Script Parameter components are separated by a "-" character.
Script Parameters are pre-defined, so you can't just make up a new one and
have it magically work. Sorry! You will need to use one of
the currently supported Script Parameters.
Tingen converts Script Parameters to lowercase for easier parsing, so you can use
whatever casing makes sense to you when creating a ScriptLink event.

SentScriptParameter.example:
To update all service information, the Script Parameter would be:
Admin-Service-Update-All
And to verify that the current user is authorized to submit an open incident:
OpenIncident-Verify-AuthorIsViewing

remarks.para:
The Tingen works with a single Avatar environment at a time, defined by one of
the following System Codes:
System Code Description
LIVE The Production environment
UAT The User Acceptance Testing environment
Your organization may have additional Avatar environments, but Tingen is only
designed/tested to work with the above System Codes.

SystemCode.value: This should be LIVE for production environments, and UAT for testing environments.

remarks.para:
Determines the delay, in milliseconds, between Trace Log writes.
Since Trace Logs may be written extremely fast, the TraceDelay setting can be
used to slow down the log writing process, ensuring all logs are written.

TraceDelay.value:
The default is 10.
Increasing this value is not recommended, since it can have an adverse affect on performance.

remarks.para:
Determines the amount of Trace Logs that are generated.
The Trace Level can be be between 0 (disabled) and 9 (all Trace Logs are written).
Trace log levels are cumulative, meaning that a level 3 trace log will also write level 2 and level 1 trace logs.

TraceLevel.value:
If you aren't having any issues, you can set this to 0.
The higher the number, the greater affect creating Trace Logs will have on performance.
